Features: Allows actuation between two shapes, Used to shape helical tendon paths
Limitations: Non-linear buckling and wrinkling buckled point has lower stiffness than rest of tube

Features: Nonlinear controller achieves consistent regulation with no overshoot, Observer compensates effect of external forces
Limitations: Larger diameters require higher control effort

Features: Four discrete joints optimised to achieve four different targets, Joint angle is controlled by varying the stiffness (via layer jamming)
Limitations: Limited rotation and bending

Features: Develops pitch-up motion based on heat welding, Maintains bending shape, Variable stiffness (via heat welding)
Limitations: Weight at robot tip limits mobility

Features: Branching improved reachability and enabled anchoring, Pouch anchoring reduces friction effects
Limitations: Limited by internal friction and head-on collisions

Features: sPAM divided into groups, instead of single series, This sPAM arrangement decreased bending angle
Limitations: Asymmetry in sPAM configuration lead to variance in RS and LS steering

Features: Growth achieved via local photopolymerisation to solidify monomer solution before it exits illuminated region, Tuning chemistry allows for varying mechanical and physical properties
Limitations: Growth timescale limited to light source positioning, Growth length limited by available monomer volume

Features: Thermocouple wire everts with robot body
Thermocouple wire everts with robot body
Branching at arbitrary points using self-healing material
Limitations: Self-healing reduces time response of system

Features: Inserts multi-joint links into structure to increase rigidity and payload capacity
Limitations: Can only move along Z- axis, Rigid links limit aperture size robot can pass through

Features: Larger fPAM diameter and denser material types maximise robot curvature
Limitations: Effect of friction and tension on results not considered

Features: Representation split into spatial curve to describe geometry and kinematic curve to approximate spatial curve
Limitations: Workspace volume decreases as number of segments is increased

Features: Fabricated with hyperelastic material (latex), Bulging and shape-locking capabilities
Limitations: Viscoelastic properties of latex limit repeatability, Risk of bursting

Features: 10-20 \% error between simulation and experimental results for curvature values, First physics-based model for tendon-driven growing robots
Limitations: Eversion unstable at large time steps, High eversion velocity leads to buckling

Features: Tactile curvature sensors integrated onto pouches and distributed along body, Uniform stiffness along length of robot (as opposed to attaching sensors directly causing stiffness mismatch)
Limitations: Noise corrupts sensor measurements, so many measurements are needed for sufficient curvature sensing performance

Features: Novel cPAM steering- Each pouch selectively actuated at tip, High DoF using with few control inputs
Limitations: Functionality depends on manufacturing methods - limited by human skills and 3d printing resolution

Features: Sensing-control-actuation loops embedded within sPAMs to steer robot towards heat source, Localised actuator response
Limitations: Slow response

Features: High manoeuvring and bending capability, Sharp bending, Stiffness control (by controlling pouch and main chamber pressure)
Limitations: Continuously changing shape limits control

Features: Miniaturised growing element
Limitations: Poor pressure resistance, High internal friction

Features: Senses environment around (temperature, humidity) and within (stiffness) the robot, Allows for shape reconstruction of robot
Limitations: Sensor protection equipment limits bending

Features: Selectable extension direction, Retractable function
Limitations: Requires larger container / space, Risk of tube deformation at increased lengths

Features: High reachability and large workspace, Permits retraction and Limited by pressure, reducing growth speed
Limitations: Unable to fit through gaps smaller than diameter, Additional weight makes it difficult to pass through gaps

Features: Origami inspired material feeding tooltip mechanism, Camera remains at tip during steering
Limitations: Vision segmentation and pressure regulation lead to delays

Features: Enables shape change and steerability, Portable, decentralised pressure supply
Limitations: Cannot direct motion properly in open spaces, Rigid head reduces shrinking capability

Features: Internal camera mount tooltip mechanism, Can pass through apertures smaller than its diameter
Limitations: Actuator force limited by strain, Limited change in orientation

Features: Tip extension reduces drag, Force modulation and control
Limitations: Can only be used for shallow soil depths, Lift force eventually saturates

Features: Real-time autonomous position and orientation control, Does not require map of environment
Limitations: Limited applications- magnetic sensors need to be placed in workspace, Limited accuracy

Features: Sensorised head, Light sensing capability
Limitations: Only senses certain wavelengths of light

Features: Millimetre scale, Improved bending and navigation compared to conventional catheter
Limitations: Requires manual labour, User needs to orient the tip manually

Features: Simulator runs in real time and handles environmental interactions, Amendable to motion planning
Limitations: Limited by computational constraints

Features: Shared autonomy between human and operator to increase situational awareness
Limitations: Human lacks autonomy during retraction

Features: Enables remote measurement tasks and sensor delivery
Limitations: Complex motion analysis

Features: More reachable than non-locking robot within the workspace, Multiple curvatures and configurations
Limitations: Manipulation only in two dimensions, Adding more tendons increases friction

Features: Predicts interaction forces, Variation of air pressure in muscle actuators changes flexural rigidity
Limitations: Deformation can occur from variation of air pressure, transforming wrinkling to bending or vice versa

Features: Shape can be varied by changing inner pressure, Stable due to heat welding
Limitations: Needs a wall to bend around, One DOF less than other steerable robots

Features: Does not disturb the environment during growth, Prevents buckling during retraction
Limitations: Requires stronger steering actuators, Rigid retraction device limits gap sizes robot can pass through

Features: Low hysteresis, Ability to fold when depressurised
Limitations: Limited contraction, Limited to simple movements

Features: Variable stiffness (by varying pressure of pouches), 3 DOF manipulator
Limitations: Limited control, Trade-off between safety and accuracy

Features: Uses obstacle interaction for navigation
Limitations: Limited growth, Inaccurate tip predictions for multiple obstacle interactions

Features: Reduces insertion force and rubbing, therefore reducing intestinal damage
Limitations: Requires high user skill level

Features: Distributed stiffness control (via layer jamming), Controls/ prevents buckling
Limitations: Jamming may affect tube inflation

Features: Tip mount remains at robot tip during retraction, Incorporates retraction without buckling
Limitations: Additional weight at tip reduces maneuverability, Rigid outer cap so it can't pass through small apertures

Features: Variable stiffness (by varying internal pressure), Can control tip's position and orientation
Limitations: Inaccurate kinematic model- does not consider friction and there is a limited number of sensors used

Features: Enables closed-loop control of robot
Limitations: Limited by irreversible growing and actuation constraints

Features: Water is used as internal fluid to increase ground pressure, Retracting motion using hydrostatic skeleton
Limitations: Increased weight of internal fluid restricts maneuverability

Features: Active steering by controlling extension speed, Variable stiffness (controlling tubing pressure)
Limitations: Limited position control, Not entirely soft

Features: Permits retraction, Corrosion resistant
Limitations: Ability to withstand hydrostatic stresses

Features: Model incorporates transverse and axial buckling modes
Limitations: Model fails to capture coupling between buckles in close proximity

Features: Extends when pressure is increased, Low weight and natural compliance
Limitations: Loss of power collapses whole structure

Features: Comprises a one DOF gripper, Gesture-based control
Limitations: Lacks autonomy, Limited tasks

Features: Pressurised tube stiffness, Active steering through independent control of actuator and tendon pressures in 3 DOF
Limitations: Buckling, Error increases with length

Features: Capability to navigate through small apertures
Limitations: Slow growth speed, Lack of shape morphing at tip (due to rigid camera), Unable to retract after growth

Features: Capability to navigate through small apertures
Limitations: Slow growth speed, Lack of shape morphing at tip (due to rigid camera), Unable to retract after growth

Features: Obstacle avoidance using PLA, without sensory perception or bending control, Bending control
Limitations: Limited curvature / bending angle

Features: Global movement split into two paths / trajectories
Limitations: Noise and curvature affect ability in reaching

Features: Helical body grasping possible, High dexterity and workspace
Limitations: Limited curvature

Features: Variable stiffness (by controlling pressure), Elongates linearly
Limitations: Unable to lengthen at forces greater than 4 N, Lacks control over direction of eversion

Features: Utilises obstacle collision for open loop navigation
Limitations: Erreneous steering, Complex

Features: Single DOF, Depth can be increased with higher pressure
Limitations: Device does not pass beyond 4cm, Stops growing when resisting force of medium is greater than the force the robot applies to environment

Features: Maps human bending commands into movements, Roll-over free capability
Limitations: Trade-off between DOF controlled by human and accuracy in orientation measurements, Limited workspace in position mode

Features: Uses single tip-breaking mechanism, Active shape change
Limitations: Limited to shapes with low surface curvature, Requires manual labour

Features: Controlled through decoupled steering, Corrections can be made during growth
Limitations: Environmental contact as the entire length of the robot body moves during steering

Features: Navigates through environment by responding to stimuli, Model can also be used for control and analysis of movement
Limitations: Melted filament shortens after each deposition, leading to systematic errors

Features: Variable stiffness (by controlling internal pressure), Reduction in shear and normal forces
Limitations: Limited steerability

Features: Eliminates friction, Reduces risk of buckling
Limitations: Performance affected by fluid pressure, Risk of thermal tissue damage

Features: Bending capability, Sensing capability
Limitations: Low resistivity of humidity sensors leads to overheating, Buckling effect limits spring's force

Features: Fast growing speed, PLA changes to ductile phase to permit bending to to follow or avoid stimulus
Limitations: Growing mechanism becomes unstable at heavier loads, Bending limited by lateral pressure of soil

Features: Quasi-static force balance
Limitations: Complex model due to inherent compliance, Apical extension limited to surface area

Features: Navigates toward light using camera, Directional control
Limitations: Limited resolution due to closely packed pouches
